Flowviz Plugin
Overview
The Flowviz plugin enables you to visualize the execution of a workflow run by ElectricCommander.
Configuration
After installing the Flowviz plugin, you must create a view (or extend an existing view) to expose the "Flowviz" tab. The view definition must contain the following XML:
<tab> <label>Flowviz</label> <url>pages/Flowviz-1.0/flowviz</url> <position>1</position> </tab>
Usage
To use the Flowviz plugin, select the "Flowviz" tab. You will be shown a simple form which you may use to specify either an active workflow or a workflow definition. Enter the required information and click the "Show workflow" button.
After a few seconds, you will see a visualization of the specified workflow or workflow definition. States are shown as boxes; transitions are the arrows between boxes.
When viewing an active workflow, the currently active state will be highlighted in red, and any available manual transitions from that state will be highlighted as well. To advance the workflow, you may click on any available transition.
When viewing a workflow definition, you may create new states by clicking the "Create State Definition" link. You can create new transitions by first clicking on a state in the graph to go to the "State Definition Detail" page, and from there adding a new transition.
